gcci.text: With the average H100 price hovering around $3.20/hour, the market appears to be in a normalization phase—indicative of easing scarcity and stabilizing chip supply chains, while capex returns are being recalibrated toward throughput and utilization rather than raw inventory accumulation.

gtpi.text: An average input token price near $1.25 per million tokens signals intense API price competition, forcing providers to drive model efficiency and potentially compress margins as DeepSeek-style pricing reshapes the competitive landscape.

gagl.text: An annual load of roughly 120 TWh underscores rising grid strain and highlights the urgent need for energy efficiency, grid flexibility, and clean baseload expansion to sustain AI growth without compromising reliability or emissions goals.

aipi.text: Hardware price normalization, token price compression, and rapidly climbing energy loads collectively point to a maturing market where margin pressure and infrastructure constraints will test the sustainability of current AI growth trajectories.
